speaker: Training Yard
lines: Dummies bleed straw like honest men.
A rack of shields remembers other grips.
A coach barks the alphabet and the letters duck.
Chalk lines mark the steps for a dance nobody teaches on purpose.
Footwork beats bladework; the yard repeats it until it is true.
A bucket of sand eats dropped knives politely.
You catch yourself smiling because you forgot to be scared.
Someone claps just once. It's enough.
